pullrequest.title: Updating units for ramses runs when boxlength matters

content.raw:
I have thought about this but not yet come to a good conclusion.
As far as I understand it, the times are output in lookback conformal time. To convert to proper time, one would have to calculate the conformal time at z=0, then add the time given in the code ( times are output as being negative already!), to get conformal time. Then this needs to be converted to proper time, or maybe the time unit already converts to proper time? It's a bit involved, and as there is adding going on it is not possible to solve it simply via the time unit. Maybe it could be handled where the fields are assigned?

Maybe one of the other ramses users has some more thoughts on this?

I have some fortran routines that do the conversion. I'll have a look at how it is handled there and see if it is something we can build into yt.
content.html:
I have thought about this but not yet come to a good conclusion. As far as I understand it, the times are output in lookback conformal time. To convert to proper time, one would have to calculate the conformal time at z=0, then add the time given in the code ( times are output as being negative already!), to get conformal time. Then this needs to be converted to proper time, or maybe the time unit already converts to proper time? It's a bit involved, and as there is adding going on it is not possible to solve it simply via the time unit. Maybe it could be handled where the fields are assigned?

Maybe one of the other ramses users has some more thoughts on this?

I have some fortran routines that do the conversion. I'll have a look at how it is handled there and see if it is something we can build into yt.

content.raw:
Yes, you can put these rules down here in a global hgignore file.  See https://www.selenic.com/mercurial/hgignore.5.html and pages linked therein.

These are for emacs auto save files, right? I'd prefer to not have these rules in the project .hgignore file either since they also indicate that there is unsaved data that might need to be recovered.
content.html:
Yes, you can put these rules down here in a global hgignore file. See https://www.selenic.com/mercurial/hgignore.5.html and pages linked therein.

These are for emacs auto save files, right? I'd prefer to not have these rules in the project .hgignore file either since they also indicate that there is unsaved data that might need to be recovered.

pullrequest.title: Updating units for ramses runs when boxlength matters

content.raw:
Just double-checked and indeed we are getting this wrong and have been for a while. This uses `output_00080` from yt.project.org/data:


```
#!python

In [1]: ds.current_time
Out[1]: -4.96603662013e+16 code_time

In [2]: ds.time_unit
Out[2]: 3.3561348625e+17 s
```

The `current_time` is obviously wrong, and I guess `time_unit` is as well.

It looks like in several other frontends we use yt's cosmology calculator to set `current_time`.  Maybe take a look at `yt/frontends/gadget/data_structures.py`?  It looks like we also do some cosmological calculations to set `current_time` in the art, artio, tipsy and rockstar frontends.
content.html:
Just double-checked and indeed we are getting this wrong and have been for a while. This uses output_00080 from yt.project.org/data:

In [1]: ds.current_time
Out[1]: -4.96603662013e+16 code_time

In [2]: ds.time_unit
Out[2]: 3.3561348625e+17 s

The current_time is obviously wrong, and I guess time_unit is as well.

It looks like in several other frontends we use yt's cosmology calculator to set current_time. Maybe take a look at yt/frontends/gadget/data_structures.py? It looks like we also do some cosmological calculations to set current_time in the art, artio, tipsy and rockstar frontends.

pullrequest.title: Updating units for ramses runs when boxlength matters

content.raw:
>> the times are output in lookback conformal time. 

This is correct, the reason why I have not spotted this is because RAMSES-CH (the patch I am using) has another field which outputs the particle age in proper time (Gyr's) in addition to the lookback conformal time. Not sure if that would have any impact on the rest of my code, but if this means that anything with code_time will be incorrect, then I am in trouble since I use particle/gas velocities quite a bit.
content.html:
the times are output in lookback conformal time.

This is correct, the reason why I have not spotted this is because RAMSES-CH (the patch I am using) has another field which outputs the particle age in proper time (Gyr's) in addition to the lookback conformal time. Not sure if that would have any impact on the rest of my code, but if this means that anything with code_time will be incorrect, then I am in trouble since I use particle/gas velocities quite a bit.

pullrequest.title: Updating units for ramses runs when boxlength matters

description:
The conversion units given in the info file still need a factors of boxlen folded in to convert correctly to cgs. In most cosmological simulation this does not matter as the boxlen=1 but it is vitally important if boxlen > 1.

This commit sets things up as follows:

unit_l -> unit_l*boxlen
unit_d -> unit_d / boxlen**3

Yt should now be able to internally track all units consistently, as well a calculate derived quantities.
